<title level="1" right="Rules">[Downtime](/Rules.aspx?ID=2008)</title>

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 9 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
PCs don’t have to spend every waking moment adventuring. They might also recover from wounds, plan future conquests, or pursue a trade. In Pathfinder, this is called [downtime](/Rules.aspx?ID=2444), and it allows time to pass quickly while characters work on long-term tasks or objectives. Most characters can practice a trade in downtime, earning a few coins, but those with the right skills can also spend time crafting, creating new gear or even magic items. Characters can also use downtime to retrain, replacing one character choice with another to reflect their evolving priorities. They might also research a problem, learn new spells, or even run a business or kingdom!
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
